numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graphs show that China produces a very large amount of energy.
2. China uses more energy in the coal industry than the US uses in all industries combined.
3. The graphs show that the proportion of nuclear energy is steady over the years.
4. Nuclear power has had many recent developments.
5. These developments make nuclear power less dangerous for the environment.
6. These developments are not reflected in the usage of nuclear power.
7. Clean energy is an issue.
8. I wonder whether connotations about an energy type affect the usage of this energy type on large scales.
9. The graphs show that wind energy and solar energy are the least clean clean energy.
10. Clean energy has three main types.
11. Wind energy and solar energy are the only clean energy type that has increased a lot over time.
12. Nuclear plants require large amounts of space.
13. Nuclear plants require large amounts of infrastructure to construct and maintain.
14. Hydroelectric plants require large amounts of space.
15. Hydroelectric plants require large amounts of infrastructure to construct and maintain.
16. This requirement could explain the steady usage of nuclear energy and hydroelectric energy.
17. It is important to be informed about this information.
18. Energy discussions are prevalent.
19. Hearing debates is an incomplete way to develop a strategy for future energy.
20. Making conclusions from debates is an incomplete way to develop a strategy for future energy.
21. If a person sees how much each country relies on each form of energy then the person is better equipped to talk about changes of energy infrastructures.
22. Such changes could improve the world in the future.
23. The title is: How the US has moved away from coal energy.
